member.name: M:SFML.Window.Cursor.#ctor(SFML.Window.Cursor.CursorType)
member.summary:
Create a native system cursor
Refer to the list of cursor available on each system (see CursorType) to know whether a given cursor is expected to load successfully or is not supported by the operating system.

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Cursor.#ctor(System.Byte[],SFML.System.Vector2u,SFML.System.Vector2u)
member.summary:
Create a cursor with the provided image
Pixels must be an array of width by height pixels in 32-bit RGBA format. If not, this will cause undefined behavior.
If pixels is null or either width or height are 0, the current cursor is left unchanged and the function will return false.
In addition to specifying the pixel data, you can also specify the location of the hotspot of the cursor. The hotspot is the pixel coordinate within the cursor image which will be located exactly where the mouse pointer position is. Any mouse actions that are performed will return the window/screen location of the hotspot.
Warning: On Unix, the pixels are mapped into a monochrome bitmap: pixels with an alpha channel to 0 are transparent, black if the RGB channel are close to zero, and white otherwise.
member.param: Array of pixels of the image
Width and height of the image

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Cursor.Destroy(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Handle the destruction of the object
member.param: Is the GC disposing the object, or is it an explicit call ?

member.name: T:SFML.Window.Joystick
member.summary: Give access to the real-time state of the joysticks

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Joystick.Axis.PovX
member.summary: The X axis of the point-of-view hat

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Joystick.Axis.PovY
member.summary: The Y axis of the point-of-view hat

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Joystick.IsConnected(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Check if a joystick is connected
member.param: Index of the joystick to check
member.returns: True if the joystick is connected, false otherwise

members.member:
Return the number of buttons supported by a joystick
If the joystick is not connected, this function returns 0. Index of the joystick Number of buttons supported by the joystick

Check if a joystick supports a given axis
If the joystick is not connected, this function returns false. Index of the joystick Axis to check True if the joystick supports the axis, false otherwise

Check if a joystick button is pressed
If the joystick is not connected, this function returns false. Index of the joystick Button to check True if the button is pressed, false otherwise

Get the current position of a joystick axis
If the joystick is not connected, this function returns 0. Index of the joystick Axis to check Current position of the axis, in range [-100 .. 100]

Update the states of all joysticks
This function is used internally by SFML, so you normally don't have to call it explicitly. However, you may need to call it if you have no window yet (or no window at all): in this case the joysticks states are not updated automatically.

member.name: T:SFML.Window.Joystick.IdentificationMarshalData
member.summary: Internal struct used for marshaling the joystick identification struct from unmanaged code.

member.name: T:SFML.Window.Keyboard
member.summary: Give access to the real-time state of the keyboard

member.name: T:SFML.Window.Keyboard.Key
member.summary:
Key codes
The enumerators refer to the "localized" key; i.e. depending on the layout set by the operating system, a key can be mapped to `Y` or `Z`.

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Keyboard.Key.LSystem
member.summary: The left OS specific key: window (Windows and Linux), apple (macOS), ...

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Keyboard.Key.RSystem
member.summary: The right OS specific key: window (Windows and Linux), apple (macOS), ...

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Keyboard.Key.KeyCount
member.summary: The total number of keyboard keys

member.name: T:SFML.Window.Keyboard.Scancode
member.summary:
Scancodes
The enumerators are bound to a physical key and do not depend on the keyboard layout used by the operating system. Usually, the AT-101 keyboard can be used as reference for the physical position of the keys.

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Keyboard.Scancode.Unknown
member.summary: Represents any scancode not present in this enum

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Keyboard.Scancode.Backslash
member.summary: Keyboard \ and | key OR various keys for Non-US keyboards

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Keyboard.Scancode.ScancodeCount
member.summary: Keep last -- the total number of scancodes

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Keyboard.IsKeyPressed(SFML.Window.Keyboard.Key)
member.summary: Check if a key is pressed
member.returns: True if the key is pressed, false otherwise

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Keyboard.IsScancodePressed(SFML.Window.Keyboard.Scancode)
member.summary: Check if a key is pressed
member.returns: True if the physical key is pressed, false otherwise

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Keyboard.Localize(SFML.Window.Keyboard.Scancode)
member.summary: Localize a physical key to a logical one
member.returns: The key corresponding to the scancode under the current keyboard layout used by the operating system, or when the scancode cannot be mapped to a .

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Keyboard.Delocalize(SFML.Window.Keyboard.Key)
member.summary: Identify the physical key corresponding to a logical one
member.returns: The scancode corresponding to the key under the current keyboard layout used by the operating system, or when the key cannot be mapped to a .

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Keyboard.GetDescription(SFML.Window.Keyboard.Scancode)
member.summary:
Provide a string representation for a given scancode
The returned string is a short, non-technical description of the key represented with the given scancode. Most effectively used in user interfaces, as the description for the key takes the users keyboard layout into consideration.
The current keyboard layout set by the operating system is used to interpret the scancode: for example, is mapped to ";" for layout and to "" for others.
member.remarks: The result is OS-dependent: for example, is "Left Meta" on Linux, "Left Windows" on Windows and "Left Command" on macOS.
member.returns: The localized description of the code

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Keyboard.SetVirtualKeyboardVisible(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Show or hide the virtual keyboard.
member.remarks: Applicable only on Android and iOS
member.param: Whether to make the virtual keyboard visible (true) or not (false)

member.name: T:SFML.Window.Mouse
member.summary: Give access to the real-time state of the mouse

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Mouse.Button.ButtonCount
member.summary: Keep last -- the total number of mouse buttons

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Mouse.IsButtonPressed(SFML.Window.Mouse.Button)
member.summary: Check if a mouse button is pressed
member.returns: True if the button is pressed, false otherwise

members.member:
Get the current position of the mouse
This function returns the current position of the mouse cursor in desktop coordinates. Current position of the mouse

Get the current position of the mouse
This function returns the current position of the mouse cursor relative to a window. Reference window Current position of the mouse

Set the current position of the mouse
This function sets the current position of the mouse cursor in desktop coordinates. New position of the mouse

Set the current position of the mouse
This function sets the current position of the mouse cursor relative to a window. New position of the mouse Reference window

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Vulkan.IsAvailable(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Tell whether or not the system supports Vulkan
This function should always be called before using the Vulkan features. If it returns false, then any attempt to use Vulkan will fail.
If only compute is required, set to false to skip checking for the extensions necessary for graphics rendering.
member.param: True to skip checking for graphics extensions, false otherwise
member.returns: True if Vulkan is supported, false otherwise

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Vulkan.GetFunction(System.String)
member.summary: Get the address of a Vulkan function
member.param: Name of the function to get the address of
member.returns: Address of the Vulkan function, on failure

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Vulkan.GetGraphicsRequiredInstanceExtensions
member.summary: Get Vulkan instance extensions required for graphics
member.returns: Vulkan instance extensions required for graphics

member.name: T:SFML.Window.Window
member.summary: Window that serves as a target for OpenGL rendering

member.summary: Create the window with default style and creation settings

member.summary: Create the window with default creation settings

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Create the window from an existing control with default creation settings

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.#ctor(System.IntPtr,SFML.Window.ContextSettings)
member.summary: Create the window from an existing control

member.name: P:SFML.Window.Window.IsOpen
member.summary: Tell whether or not the window is opened (ie. has been created). Note that a hidden window (Show(false)) will still return true
member.returns: True if the window is opened

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.Close
member.summary: Close (destroy) the window. The Window instance remains valid and you can call Create to recreate the window

member.name: P:SFML.Window.Window.Size
member.summary: Size of the rendering region of the window

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetTitle(System.String)
member.summary: Change the title of the window

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetIcon(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.Byte[])
member.param: Array of pixels, format must be RGBA 32 bits

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetVisible(System.Boolean)
member.param: True to show the window, false to hide it

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetMouseCursorVisible(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Show or hide the mouse cursor
member.param: True to show, false to hide

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetMouseCursorGrabbed(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Grab or release the mouse cursor
member.param: True to grab, false to release
member.remarks: If set, grabs the mouse cursor inside this window's client area so it may no longer be moved outside its bounds. Note that grabbing is only active while the window has focus and calling this function for fullscreen windows won't have any effect (fullscreen windows always grab the cursor).

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetMouseCursor(SFML.Window.Cursor)
member.summary: Set the displayed cursor to a native system cursor
member.param: Native system cursor type to display

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetVerticalSyncEnabled(System.Boolean)
member.param: True to enable v-sync, false to deactivate

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetKeyRepeatEnabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enable or disable automatic key-repeat. Automatic key-repeat is enabled by default
member.param: True to enable, false to disable

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetActive
member.summary: Activate the window as the current target for rendering
member.returns: True if operation was successful, false otherwise

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetActive(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Activate of deactivate the window as the current target for rendering
member.param: True to activate, false to deactivate (true by default)
member.returns: True if operation was successful, false otherwise

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetFramerateLimit(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Limit the framerate to a maximum fixed frequency
member.param: Framerate limit, in frames per seconds (use 0 to disable limit)

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.SetJoystickThreshold(System.Single)
member.summary: Change the joystick threshold, ie. the value below which no move event will be generated

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.RequestFocus
member.summary: Request the current window to be made the active foreground window

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.HasFocus
member.summary: Check whether the window has the input focus
member.returns: True if the window has focus, false otherwise

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.CreateVulkanSurface(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr@,System.IntPtr)
member.returns: True if surface creation was successful, false otherwise

member.summary: Provide a string describing the object

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.#ctor(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.param: Pointer to the internal object in the C API

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.InternalGetMousePosition
member.summary: Internal function to get the mouse position relative to the window. This function is protected because it is called by another class of another module, it is not meant to be called by users.

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.InternalSetMousePosition(SFML.System.Vector2i)
member.summary: Internal function to set the mouse position relative to the window. This function is protected because it is called by another class of another module, it is not meant to be called by users.

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.InternalGetTouchPosition(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Internal function to get the touch position relative to the window. This function is protected because it is called by another class of another module, it is not meant to be called by users.

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.PollEvent(SFML.Window.Event@)
member.summary: Internal function to get the next event (non-blocking)
member.param: Variable to fill with the raw pointer to the event structure
member.returns: True if there was an event, false otherwise

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.WaitEvent(SFML.Window.Event@)
member.summary: Internal function to get the next event (blocking)
member.param: Variable to fill with the raw pointer to the event structure

member.name: M:SFML.Window.Window.Destroy(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Handle the destruction of the object
member.param: Is the GC disposing the object, or is it an explicit call ?

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Styles.None
member.summary: No border / title bar (this flag and all others are mutually exclusive)

member.name: F:SFML.Window.Styles.Fullscreen
member.summary: Fullscreen mode (this flag and all others are mutually exclusive))

member.summary: Close (destroy) the window. The Window instance remains valid and you can call Create to recreate the window

member.name: M:SFML.Window.WindowBase.SetMouseCursorGrabbed(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Grab or release the mouse cursor
member.param: True to grab, false to release
member.remarks: If set, grabs the mouse cursor inside this window's client area so it may no longer be moved outside its bounds. Note that grabbing is only active while the window has focus and calling this function for fullscreen windows won't have any effect (fullscreen windows always grab the cursor).

member.name: M:SFML.Window.WindowBase.SetMouseCursor(SFML.Window.Cursor)
member.summary:
Set the displayed cursor to a native system cursor
Upon window creation, the arrow cursor is used by default.
member.param: Native system cursor type to display

member.name: M:SFML.Window.WindowBase.SetKeyRepeatEnabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Enable or disable automatic key-repeat.
If key repeat is enabled, you will receive repeated events while keeping a key pressed. If it is disabled, you will only get a single event when the key is pressed.
Automatic key-repeat is enabled by default
member.param: True to enable, false to disable

member.name: M:SFML.Window.WindowBase.SetJoystickThreshold(System.Single)
member.summary: Change the joystick threshold, ie. the value below which no move event will be generated

member.summary: Wait for a new event and dispatch it to the corresponding event handler

member.name: M:SFML.Window.WindowBase.DispatchEvents
member.summary: Call the event handlers for each pending event
